name: infoEnergy
body:
### Welcome to the Information-Energy Nexus
**A working group at [the University of California, Berkeley](http://www.berkeley.edu)** that focuses on the transformative role of information technology on modern energy systems.  infoEnergy shares knowledge and builds tools together to do data-driven science, market, and policy research.

- Defining an open science agenda for supporting next generation energy systems.
- Building shared research infrastructure (open source code and datasets) for energy research and policy development in a data-driven world.
- Partnering with like-minded groups across the Berkeley campus and beyond (like [Cleanweb Berkeley](http://berkeley.cleanweb.co) and the [Berkeley Rural Energy Group](http://breg.berkeley.edu))
- Organizing a conference / workshop for Summer 2014 


```
We create and curate open-source code.
We find and share links with open data.
Check it out in the repositories.

Latest Addition: CAISO market data API functions for R...
And now there's a demo of using the CAISO functions too.

More to come...
```
![[infoEnergy]](http://www.alstone.co/wp-content/uploads/2014/01/infoEnergy-logo2-icon.jpg)

Go to the repositories at [github.com/infoenergy](http://github.com/infoenergy) and join the effort.

## Schedule
We meet every other week at the [D-Lab](http://dlab.berkeley.edu) convening room in Barrows Hall room 356 (on the western end of the third floor) at UC Berkeley.

### Next Meeting
**April 11, 2014 from Noon-1 PM**

**Agenda**
Andrew Crane-Droesch discusses challenges and opportunities for Tablet Computer Surveys (using Open Data Kit).  

We broadcast parts of our meetings and archive basic notes publicly on [a google plus page](https://plus.google.com/b/112947358931165650753/112947358931165650753/about).

### Typical Meeting Agenda
*Tools and Datasets (20-30 min)*
- Learn about a new analysis tool or software package with demos
- Get a tour and explore a dataset or API 

*Discussion and collaboration (20-30 min)*
- Collaboratively define and execute an open data science agenda for energy 
- Plan events (hackathon, workshop, etc.)
- Find collaborators and workshop project ideas


### Meeting Archive

[March 14, 2014](https://plus.google.com/b/112947358931165650753/events/cs4map02c6bjftdglt2sspo1m1o)

[February 28, 2014](https://plus.google.com/b/112947358931165650753/events/cglpm92gtk43j8it3h46hot2nd4)

[February 14, 2014](https://plus.google.com/b/112947358931165650753/events/cih2r42df1464h7po891lqb8tcg)

## Connect
[Join the google group to stay up-to-date.](https://groups.google.com/d/forum/infoenergy)

## Links

### D-Lab
The [D-Lab](http://dlab.berkeley.edu/) supports data-intense social science research at UC Berkeley.  Our interdisciplinary group meets is a [D-Lab working group](http://dlab.berkeley.edu/working-groups) and we meet in a D-Lab convening space.  

### Berkeley Rural Energy Group
[BREG](http://breg.berkeley.edu) is an important partner for infoEnergy's work in the off-grid space, providing a forum for engaging practitioners and academics who are working on energy issues in the developing world.  

### Cleanweb Berkeley
Working with [Cleanweb](http://berkeley.cleanweb.co) we contribute to developing ventures and startups that can take information technology ideas to scale in the private and public sectors.  

### Berkeley Energy and Resources Collaborative
We are a [BERC Community](http://berc.berkeley.edu/programs/berc-communities/).

## Archive
[This was the flyer from the first meeting](http://www.alstone.co/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/infoEnergyAnnounce-799x1024.jpg)
